sentences.en: "I could take the subway and have David pick me up at the station." — "Nothing doing."
sentences.cn: “我可以坐地铁，然后让戴维到车站接我。”——“不行。”

sentences.en: A 15-year-old girl was attacked at knifepoint in a subway.
sentences.cn: 一名15岁的女孩在地铁里遭持刀袭击。

sentences.en: Boston has the oldest subway system in the US.
sentences.cn: 波士顿拥有美国最老的地铁运输系统。

sentences.en: Diego noticed Pamela when she got on the subway train.
sentences.cn: 在帕梅拉走进地铁的时候,蒂亚哥看到了她.

sentences.en: He goes to work on the subway.
Homeless people forced to cadge in subway stations.
sentences.cn: 无家可归的人们被迫在地铁站里乞讨。

sentences.en: I don't ride the subway late at night.
Many of the city's populace travel to work by subway or bus.
sentences.cn: 许多城市的平民都是坐地铁或公共汽车上下班.

sentences.en: Ray used to sing and play the guitar in the subway.
sentences.cn: 雷经常在地铁里边唱边弹吉他.

sentences.en: Steps lead down to the subway from the upstream side.
sentences.cn: 上游那边有台阶通向地铁。

sentences.en: The majority of us feel worried if we walk through a subway.
sentences.cn: 大多数人在走地下通道时都感到害怕。

sentences.en: The new subway is now being laid.
The subway was covered in graffiti.
sentences.cn: 过街地道里涂满了乱七八糟的图画和文字。

sentences.en: Trains are thundering in and out all the time at a subway station.
sentences.cn: 地铁车站上列车进进出出,整天轰隆轰隆地响个不停.

trans.tran_en: a railway system that runs under the ground below a big city
a railway system that runs under the ground below a big city
